result.execSummary:
The defendant Myron Drew Lemieux was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty does not know where her client is.  Court makes stmt.  State requests warrant and forfeiture proceedings.  Court grants request.  10:59 Am  Court recalls case as defendant has just appeared.  Court addressed the defendant - warrant quashed.  Matter is resolved.

Defendant Myron Drew Lemieux in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:30 AM  Court calls case and appearances.  Defendant states he is homeless right now and stays with a friend 7692N Hwy E, Hayward WI.  Atty Yohnk just rec'd an offer.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Myron Drew Lemieux in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   3:29 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Defendant is fine with video.  Court further addressed the defendant was suppose to appear in February.  Defendant states he is homeless at this time and does not have a job he is staying with a friend and is on food stamps.  3 charges on the complaint court recites these charges.  Advised him as to his rights and his right to an Atty - advised to contact the public defender's office. Court entered not guilty plea.   State requests bail $500.00 cash  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.
A Complaint has been filed charging the defendant with the commission of an offense.

APPEARANCES: Defendant Myron Drew Lemieux not in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Based on nonappearance, State requests warrant; court authorizes warrant.
